ffffs005 Ultimate Nullifier
Rarity: Super Rare
Looking for Inventory Management? Please Login w/ "Remember Me?" option selected.
Ultimate Nullifier
EQUIP: Any. UNEQUIP: Drop. EFFECT: POWER: Choose an opposing character within 6 squares and line of fire then choose a number from 1-6 to be X and roll a d6. If the result is higher than X, deal X damage to the chosen character. If the result is lower than X, deal X damage to this character. If the result is equal to X, deal X damage to both characters. Light Object.
10 Points
Trade Ultimate Nullifier Want Ultimate Nullifier

July 11, 2021
Dortmuner
Dang. Just realized you can stick it on WW80061, wait til she hits her -5 plot point special and go to town. She can't be damaged, so just keep picking 3 or 4. You're either doing 3 points of damage two out of three times or four damage half the time and she won't take any damage from matching or rolling lower. You would tear through the opponents as long as you protected your Amazonian teammates. [b](Special) (-5) Protect Man's World from the Enemies of Themyscira: [/b]FREE: Turn Wonder Woman, Princess of Themyscira to click #11. This game she has Cosmic Energy team ability, SAFEGUARD: Pulse Wave, and can't be damaged. // At the beginning of your turn, if there are no other friendly characters with the Amazon keyword on the map, you lose the game.
July 11, 2021
Dioneo
Not a great all purpose item, but it does have its uses. You could stick it on any fig with zero range (or a lot of battle fury) to give it a ranged option. Since knock back isn't damaging under the new rules, this would be one of the easier ways to ding pesky high defence value characters with non-damage reducing powers like super senses and/or shape change.
May 18, 2021
Goop
What you are likely going to do is put this on someone with Invul, Imperv or Invinc. Call 2 every time and target someone without any reducers. If you roll a 2 or less your invul will protect you, any higher and thats 2 direct to your opponent. You could probably call 3 also if you want to risk a little.
May 3, 2021
SuperGrunt
After having played with it, I think it's safe to say that the best way to use it is with common BWM Taskmaster. Definitely great for a fun game.
March 15, 2021
RockyRaccoon
You can use this with Batman prime to easily get to his last click in one single turn(where he gains Penetrating/Psychic Blast, 12 attack and 4 damage. Although, granted you’d need to roll a 1-3 for that effect but even if you get a 4-6 that still means you’re dealing 3 damage without even rolling for an attack!!). Seems like it could be fun, but either way this just seems like a fun object I’d use for casual games. Not the best object but it’s certainly far from bad. It’s certainly a great way to get rid of bystanders or 1-2 click figures(Like Dr. Fate) without even making an attack.

Uatu can't equip this because he's giant. 20 point Reed would have a 16.67% chance of doing 6 damage and would still die. It's just not a very good object! Legacy Mr. Fantastic might make the best use of it, because he'd be able to prevent himself from being KO'd with Find A Way To Save My Family. That plus HERBIE's trait would be annoying keeping Sidekicks alive.

Skeleman
STOP doesn't work that way either. [QUOTE][B]When this click is revealed due to damage taken from an opponent’s attack[/B], stop turning the dial. When this character would be healed by Regeneration or Support, it’s healed 1 less click. Protected: Outwit, Pulse Wave[/QUOTE]

Goop
I'm not sure you are reading this piece correctly. You roll the dice and call a number, in order to do ANY damage to your opponent you need to roll that number or higher.

FlashSpidey
I imagine this could be good with Uatu himself, or really anyone with a reducer and low damage. Just pick 2 if the opponent doesn't have a reducer and it's free damage without gear of shape change or super senses cause it isn't an attack. Feels deceptively good in the right situations. And really fun.
February 27, 2021
Daunting Mountain
Only Mr. Mxyzptlk would be able to replace the Ultimate Nullifier roll, or Taskmaster if he himself is using it. The rest of d6 replacement effects specify what kind of roll can be affected.
February 27, 2021
tidge
If playing with a d6-replacement figure, the Ultimate Nullifier seems like a useful toy to consider adding to your force.
February 19, 2021
JDHCR
If you have invincible/invulnerable/impervious, you can pick 2 every time. If you roll 2 or lower, you take no damage... and if you roll 2 or higher, your opponent without a reducer would take 2. or go a little higher and reduce 2 of the damage you do to them if you roll equal or higher.

February 17, 2021
LostGaladorian
Because the damage isn't penetrating or unavoidable, and your target may have a reducer. If X=1, the damage dealt will be 1, no matter how high you roll. Yeah, you're safe from taking damage yourself (unless you roll a 1 and you both take 1), but you're not doing a lot of damage to the opponent by picking X=1.
